definition: to turn hostile suddenly/face changing, a device of Sichuan Opera, a dramatic change of attitude expressing fright, anger etc
to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
to show one's face/to make one's good name/to become successful and well known/to shine
types of facial makeup in operas

sentences.english: And those grownup who lose to a kid have the audacity to complaint?
sentences.chinese: 这些输了的成年人还有脸抱怨？

sentences.english: Moses manages to placate God momentarily, and then he turns around to face the people.
sentences.chinese: 摩西想马上安抚上帝，他把脸转向人民。

sentences.english: She tilted her face to kiss me quickly on the chin.
sentences.chinese: 她侧过脸飞快地在我下巴上亲了一下。

sentences.english: Candy's face reddens, but she manages to force a smile.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂的脸涨红，却强挤出了一丝笑容。

sentences.english: It was, Houllier said with a completely straight face, my tribute to Rigobert.
sentences.chinese: 侯利亚完全不露表情的脸说，那是我对桑治的敬意。

sentences.english: In the moment and again the flash across is that girl's face, Qiong's eventually preoccupied of her is who.
sentences.chinese: 眼前再次闪过那个女孩的脸，琼终于想起了她是谁。

sentences.english: I rang again and a maid with a sullen face opened the door .
sentences.chinese: 我又揿了一下门铃，一名侍女紧绷着脸把门开了。

sentences.english: Of someone who rose and fell apart at the edge of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 在我们生活边缘涨起又落下的某个人的脸。

sentences.english: When you peep out the successful smiling face.
sentences.chinese: 当你外面偷看时成功微笑的脸。

sentences.english: If you have a triangle shaped face, this means that you have a pointy chin.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有一张三角型的脸，这意味着你有一个尖下巴。

sentences.english: They that were sometime my counsellors, have abhorred me: and he whom I love most is turned against me.
sentences.chinese: 我的知交密友都憎恶我，我所爱的人也对我变了脸。

sentences.english: They linger and look at your face and smile mere idle sport.
sentences.chinese: 它们留连下落拓地看着你的脸微笑着。

sentences.english: I dried myself with a handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 我自己拿手巾擦干了脸。

sentences.english: Butterfly shapes accentuate the sweetness of heart-shaped faces.
sentences.chinese: 蝶形的太阳镜会凸显处心形脸的甜美。

sentences.english: Daisy took her face in her hands as if feeling its lovely shape.
sentences.chinese: 黛西把她的脸埋在手中，好象在感觉那娇好的轮廓。

definition: mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
self-respect of old person/face/thick-skinned (i.e. impervious to criticism)/brazen
